awd_titl_txt: Engineering Faculty Internship:  Quantifying Plasma         Generated Particle and Charge Build Up Damage in Submicron  Manufacturing
awd_abstract_narration: The propose work will address two interrelated issues:                     undesired plasma based particle generation and plasma created                   damage to underlying devices.  Both proposed studies strongly                   impact the yield of working die in manufacturing and share the                  common issues of a plasma environment.  The initial focus will be               in plasma ashing of polymer photoresist which occurs 10 - 15 times              in the manufacturing cycle and is therefore leveraged to                        productivity.  In-situ plasma conditions as measured by optical                 methods will be correlated with post-process particle distributions             on wafers as well as plasma damage to device structures.                             If successful to results will allow higher yields and greater              productivity in the production of semiconductor devices.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
